snippet: In the leaked 192-page document, posted by an Italian magazine, the pope offers a broad vision of an endangered planet and partly blames human activity for global warming.
abstract: Leaked draft of papal encyclical on environment has Pope Francis calling for swift action on climate change by people of all religions; includes references to scientific evidence and touches on familiar themes regarding inequality and anti-consumerism.

byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: In the leaked 192-page document, posted by an Italian magazine, the pope offers a broad vision of an endangered planet and partly blames human activity for global warming.

headline.main: Pope Francis Calls for Climate Action in Draft of Encyclical
headline.print_headline: Draft of Pope’s Climate Encyclical Calls for Action
